summary: Interactive romantic Valentine-themed web experience: a 5-question MCQ love quiz with pastel romantic UI, animations, and playful Valentine "Yes/No" trick, ending with results screens and a redeemable date coupon.
architectural_notes: Mobile-first responsive single-page web experience with simple client-side state management (welcome â†’ quiz â†’ results â†’ Valentine trick).
No login; app should be lightweight/fast and easily shareable (static deployment friendly).

existing_features.title: Build a single-page, mobile-first romantic interactive web experience with a 5-question multiple-choice love quiz, using a soft pastel Valentine aesthetic (pinks, blush, beige, subtle gradients), rounded cards, hearts, cute emoji accents, smooth transitions, and playful micro-interactions. All user-facing text must be in English and match the provided copy exactly.

Implement the Welcome Screen with the following elements and interactions: Title â€œHow Well Do You Know Your Boy? ğŸ’–â€, subtitle â€œA tiny test made with love just for youâ€, and a prominent primary button labeled â€œStart the Love Test â†’â€ that transitions into the quiz flow with a smooth animation.

Use the exact questions, options, and correct answers provided.

Add a special sparkle animation when the user selects â€œEverythingâ€ for Q4 (â€œWhat do you like about me the most?â€). This sparkle effect must be distinct from the standard correct-answer heart/confetti effect.
Implement scoring and result logic: compute total correct answers out of 5 and route to different result screens based on score (perfect 5/5 vs less than 5). No login is required.

Create the Non-Perfect (<5) result screen with a cute/funny (not mean) teasing meme image and the exact copy: â€œHmmâ€¦ not perfect ğŸ‘€\n\nYou need to do betterâ€¦ but I still love you.â€ Then show: â€œWill you still be my Valentine? ğŸ’˜â€ with two buttons: â€œYes ğŸ’–â€ and â€œNo ğŸ˜ˆâ€.

Implement the Valentine Trick interaction on the non-perfect result path: when the user clicks â€œNo ğŸ˜ˆâ€, progressively enlarge the â€œYes ğŸ’–â€ button and shrink the â€œNo ğŸ˜ˆâ€ button, while changing the prompt text in sequence: first to â€œAre you sure?? ğŸ¥ºâ€, then to â€œYou have no escape ğŸ˜Œâ€, and continue the shrink/grow behavior on subsequent â€œNoâ€ clicks until â€œYesâ€ fills most of the screen and â€œNoâ€ becomes almost impossible to click. When the user clicks â€œYes ğŸ’–â€, show the final celebration screen: â€œYAY!!! You are my Valentine forever ğŸ’–ğŸŒ¹â€ with confetti + hearts + romantic animation.

Add a floating hearts background effect across the experience (welcome, quiz, and result screens) that is subtle, performant, and does not reduce readability. Include gentle animated transitions between major screens (welcome â†’ quiz â†’ results).

Optional audio: provide gentle background music and subtle sound effects for key interactions (start, selecting an option, correct answer celebration, final celebration). Audio must be off by default or require an explicit user action to start, and provide simple controls (mute/unmute or play/pause).

Provide a shareable link experience with no login required: include a â€œCopy Linkâ€ control somewhere appropriate (e.g., welcome or results) that copies the current page URL to the clipboard and shows a cute confirmation micro-interaction (toast/callout).

Add required static assets rendering: include the generated meme images as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the perfect-score and non-perfect result screens respectively.

Update the quiz content for Q1 (the first question) so that the question "When is our anniversary (don't check my status oops)?" has exactly these options in this order: A) "14th Feb 2021", B) "25th Nov 2021", C) "26th Nov 2021", D) "You were born knowing me"; and set the correct answer to "25th Nov 2021".

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a 5-question MCQ love quiz web app with welcome screen, per-question card UI, progress indicator, and animated answer feedback
Implement quiz content and scoring logic with specific questions/options/correct answers, including special sparkle animation when selecting â€œEverythingâ€ on Q4
Create results screens: perfect score (5/5) win screen with date coupon and â€œRedeem My Date ğŸ’Œâ€ interaction; non-perfect score teasing screen with Valentine prompt
Implement Valentine trick interaction: repeated â€œNoâ€ clicks shrink No/grow Yes and change prompt text until Yes dominates; clicking Yes triggers final celebration screen with confetti/hearts
Design romantic UI/UX: soft pastel gradients, floating hearts background, rounded cards, subtle animations/transitions, playful micro-interactions, mobile-first responsive, fast/no login
Optional audio: gentle background music and subtle sound effects with user-friendly controls
Provide a shareable link (no login required) for easy sharing
